heya guys: can anyone tell me what the purpose of the keyring manager is?
my problem is that upon boot the keyring manager always asks for my password
then my wireless also asks for my password
I thought the keyring manager was supposed to remember my wireless key
and maybe not prompt me for a password all the time, since that is counter-productive
to prevent Keyring manager from prompting for the password, install the package: libpam-gnome-keyring
ok first, for libpam-gnome-keyring to work your Login password and your default keyring password should be the same
oh, hmm that might actually be the problem, I am not sure if libpam-keyring and autologin work together
wireless should be prompt free as well. you should only have to enter ONE login password
if its prompting for wireless password, I would suggest deleting your keyrings (System -> Administration -> Keyring Manager)
